titleInfo.title: WAS brought to the City Police Jail.

subject.geographic: On the Gentilly road, near St. Bernard parish

mods.abstract: WAS brought to the City Police Jail on the 24th of September, 1861, the black girl MARGARET ELIZABETH. Says she belongs to Dr. Carlton or Mr. John B. Hersey who lives on the Gentilly road, near the parish of St. Bernard. She is 4 feet 8 1/4 inches high, has very good teeth, a pleasant face, bushy hair, several scars on the right and left arms and on the back, is in the family way, and is aged about 24 or 25 years. The owner will call and claim his property according to law. MIGUEL HERNANDEZ, JR., Keeper of City Police Jail. Registered October 29, 1861. E. DEVENPORT, Clerk of Comptroller. o30 15t
mods.note: Dr. Carlton or Mr. John B. Hersey

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
